name: IEEE 802.11
definition: Wireless LAN (Wi-Fi) standard for wireless communication.

name: IEEE 802.3
definition: Ethernet standard for wired LAN communication.

name: IEEE 802.1Q
definition: Standard for VLAN (Virtual LAN) tagging.

name: IEEE 802.15.4
definition: Standard for low-rate wireless personal area networks (WPANs).

name: IEEE 1394 (FireWire)
definition: Standard for high-speed serial bus used for connecting devices.

name: IEEE 802.16 (WiMAX)
definition: Standard for wireless broadband communication.

name: IEEE 754
definition: Standard for floating-point arithmetic in computers.

name: IEEE 488 (GPIB)
definition: Standard for connecting and controlling instruments in test and measurement applications.

name: IEEE 802.22
definition: Standard for cognitive radio networks using unused TV channels.

name: IEEE 802.11ac
definition: Wireless LAN standard providing faster data rates and improved performance.

name: IEEE 802.1X
definition: Standard for port-based network access control.

name: IEEE 802.11n
definition: Wireless LAN standard providing enhanced throughput and range.

name: IEEE 802.3af
definition: Standard for Power over Ethernet (PoE) to deliver power to network devices.

name: IEEE 802.1D
definition: Standard for bridge and LAN switching operations.

name: IEEE 802.1Qbg
definition: Standard for bridging of virtual machines within a data center.

name: IEEE 802.15.1 (Bluetooth)
definition: Standard for short-range wireless communication between devices.

name: IEEE 802.3at
definition: Standard for Power over Ethernet Plus (PoE+) with higher power delivery.

name: IEEE 802.11ax
definition: Wireless LAN standard providing improved efficiency and capacity.

name: IEEE 802.3az (Energy-Efficient Ethernet)
definition: Standard for reducing energy consumption in Ethernet networks.

name: IEEE 802.1AE (MACsec)
definition: Standard for securing Ethernet frames at the MAC layer.

name: IEEE 802.11ad
definition: Wireless LAN standard for high-speed short-range communication using millimeter waves.

name: IEEE 802.3bt (PoE++)
definition: Standard for delivering even higher power over Ethernet cables.

name: IEEE 802.1Qbv
definition: Standard for time-sensitive networking in Ethernet networks.

name: IEEE 802.11ay
definition: Wireless LAN standard for extremely high-speed short-range communication.

name: IEEE 802.3cg (10BASE-T1S)
definition: Standard for Ethernet communication over single twisted-pair cables.
